name: KBV_PR_Base_DiagnosticReport
title: KBV_PR_Base_DiagnosticReport
description: Dieses Profil bildet einen Befund / Bericht ab.

element.short: A Diagnostic report - a combination of request information, atomic results, images, interpretation, as well as formatted reports
element.definition: Dieses Profil bildet einen Befund / Bericht ab.
element.comment: This is intended to capture a single report and is not suitable for use in displaying summary information that covers multiple reports.  For example, this resource has not been designed for laboratory cumulative reporting formats nor detailed structured reports for sequencing.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.xpath: not(exists(for $id in f:contained/*/f:id/@value return $contained[not(parent::*/descendant::f:reference/@value=concat('#', $contained/*/id/@value) or descendant::f:reference[@value='#'])]))

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.definition: Identifiers assigned to this report by the performer or other systems.
element.comment: Usually assigned by the Information System of the diagnostic service provider (filler id).
element.requirements: Need to know what identifier to use when making queries about this report from the source laboratory, and for linking to the report outside FHIR context.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: CX / EI (occasionally, more often EI maps to a resource id or a URL)
II - The Identifier class is a little looser than the v3 type II because it allows URIs as well as registered OIDs or GUIDs.  Also maps to Role[classCode=IDENT]
OBR-51/ for globally unique filler ID  - OBR-3 , For non-globally unique filler-id the flller/placer number must be combined with the universal service Id -  OBR-2(if present)+OBR-3+OBR-4

element.definition: Details concerning a service requested.
element.comment: Note: Usually there is one test request for each result, however in some circumstances multiple test requests may be represented using a single test result resource. Note that there are also cases where one request leads to multiple reports.
element.requirements: This allows tracing of authorization for the report and tracking whether proposals/recommendations were acted upon.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
SHALL have a contained resource if a local reference is provided

mapping.map: The target of a resource reference is a RIM entry point (Act, Role, or Entity)

element.definition: Hier wird der Status des Befunds/Berichts als Code aus dem ValueSet: http://www.hl7.org/fhir/valueset-diagnostic-report-status.html angegeben.
element.comment: Note that FHIR strings SHALL NOT exceed 1MB in size
element.requirements: Diagnostic services routinely issue provisional/incomplete reports, and sometimes withdraw previously released reports.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

binding.description: The status of the diagnostic report.

mapping.map: statusCode  Note: final and amended are distinguished by whether observation is the subject of a ControlAct event of type "revise"

element.definition: Hier wird der Inhalt bzw. die Bedeutung des Elements anhand eines entsprechenden Codes oder alternativ mit einem Freitext angegeben.
element.comment: Multiple categories are allowed using various categorization schemes.   The level of granularity is defined by the category concepts in the value set. More fine-grained filtering can be performed using the metadata and/or terminology hierarchy in DiagnosticReport.code.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Code defined by a terminology system
element.definition: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
element.comment: Codes may be defined very casually in enumerations, or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the HL7 v3 Core Principles for more information.  Ordering of codings is undefined and SHALL NOT be used to infer meaning. Generally, at most only one of the coding values will be labeled as UserSelected = true.
element.requirements: Allows for alternative encodings within a code system, and translations to other code systems.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: CE/CNE/CWE subset one of the sets of component 1-3 or 4-6

element.short: Plain text representation of the concept
element.definition: Hier wird ein Freitext eingetragen.
element.comment: Very often the text is the same as a displayName of one of the codings.
element.requirements: The codes from the terminologies do not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the human using them, or sometimes there is no appropriate code at all. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this

element.definition: A code or name that describes this diagnostic report.
element.comment: Not all terminology uses fit this general pattern. In some cases, models should not use CodeableConcept and use Coding directly and provide their own structure for managing text, codings, translations and the relationship between elements and pre- and post-coordination.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: OBR-4 (HL7 v2 doesn't provide an easy way to indicate both the ordered test and the performed panel)

element.short: Plain text representation of the concept
element.definition: Hier wird der Titel des Dokuments angegeben.
element.comment: Very often the text is the same as a displayName of one of the codings.
element.requirements: The codes from the terminologies do not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the human using them, or sometimes there is no appropriate code at all. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this

element.short: The subject of the report - usually, but not always, the patient
element.definition: The subject of the report. Usually, but not always, this is a patient. However, diagnostic services also perform analyses on specimens collected from a variety of other sources.
element.comment: References SHALL be a reference to an actual FHIR resource, and SHALL be resolveable (allowing for access control, temporary unavailability, etc.). Resolution can be either by retrieval from the URL, or, where applicable by resource type, by treating an absolute reference as a canonical URL and looking it up in a local registry/repository.
element.requirements: SHALL know the subject context.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
SHALL have a contained resource if a local reference is provided

mapping.map: The target of a resource reference is a RIM entry point (Act, Role, or Entity)
PID-3 (no HL7 v2 mapping for Group or Device)

element.short: Health care event when test ordered
element.definition: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) which this DiagnosticReport is about.
element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some events may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter  but still be tied to the context of the encounter  (e.g. pre-admission laboratory tests).
element.requirements: Links the request to the Encounter context.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
SHALL have a contained resource if a local reference is provided

mapping.map: The target of a resource reference is a RIM entry point (Act, Role, or Entity)

element.definition: The time or time-period the observed values are related to. When the subject of the report is a patient, this is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection(s), but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.
element.comment: If the diagnostic procedure was performed on the patient, this is the time it was performed. If there are specimens, the diagnostically relevant time can be derived from the specimen collection times, but the specimen information is not always available, and the exact relationship between the specimens and the diagnostically relevant time is not always automatic.
element.requirements: Need to know where in the patient history to file/present this report.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Hier wird das Datum angegeben, das für den Befund/Bericht relevant ist.
element.comment: If the diagnostic procedure was performed on the patient, this is the time it was performed. If there are specimens, the diagnostically relevant time can be derived from the specimen collection times, but the specimen information is not always available, and the exact relationship between the specimens and the diagnostically relevant time is not always automatic.
element.requirements: Need to know where in the patient history to file/present this report.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Hier wird der Zeitraum angegeben, der für den Befund/Bericht relevant ist.
element.comment: If the diagnostic procedure was performed on the patient, this is the time it was performed. If there are specimens, the diagnostically relevant time can be derived from the specimen collection times, but the specimen information is not always available, and the exact relationship between the specimens and the diagnostically relevant time is not always automatic.
element.requirements: Need to know where in the patient history to file/present this report.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The date and time that this version of the report was made available to providers, typically after the report was reviewed and verified.
element.comment: May be different from the update time of the resource itself, because that is the status of the record (potentially a secondary copy), not the actual release time of the report.
element.requirements: Clinicians need to be able to check the date that the report was released.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Hier wird die Person referenziert, die für Erstellung des Befunds/Berichts verantwortlich ist.
element.comment: This is not necessarily the source of the atomic data items or the entity that interpreted the results. It is the entity that takes responsibility for the clinical report.
element.requirements: Need to know whom to contact if there are queries about the results. Also may need to track the source of reports for secondary data analysis.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
SHALL have a contained resource if a local reference is provided

mapping.map: The target of a resource reference is a RIM entry point (Act, Role, or Entity)

element.definition: The practitioner or organization that is responsible for the report's conclusions and interpretations.
element.comment: Might not be the same entity that takes responsibility for the clinical report.
element.requirements: Need to know whom to contact if there are queries about the results. Also may need to track the source of reports for secondary data analysis.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
SHALL have a contained resource if a local reference is provided

mapping.map: The target of a resource reference is a RIM entry point (Act, Role, or Entity)

element.short: Specimens this report is based on
element.definition: Details about the specimens on which this diagnostic report is based.
element.comment: If the specimen is sufficiently specified with a code in the test result name, then this additional data may be redundant. If there are multiple specimens, these may be represented per observation or group.
element.requirements: Need to be able to report information about the collected specimens on which the report is based.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
SHALL have a contained resource if a local reference is provided

mapping.map: The target of a resource reference is a RIM entry point (Act, Role, or Entity)

element.definition: Hier werden die einzelnen Ergebnisse des Befunds/Berichts referenziert
element.comment: Observations can contain observations.
element.requirements: Need to support individual results, or  groups of results, where the result grouping is arbitrary, but meaningful.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
SHALL have a contained resource if a local reference is provided

mapping.map: The target of a resource reference is a RIM entry point (Act, Role, or Entity)

element.short: Reference to full details of imaging associated with the diagnostic report
element.definition: One or more links to full details of any imaging performed during the diagnostic investigation. Typically, this is imaging performed by DICOM enabled modalities, but this is not required. A fully enabled PACS viewer can use this information to provide views of the source images.
element.comment: ImagingStudy and the image element are somewhat overlapping - typically, the list of image references in the image element will also be found in one of the imaging study resources. However, each caters to different types of displays for different types of purposes. Neither, either, or both may be provided.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
SHALL have a contained resource if a local reference is provided

mapping.map: The target of a resource reference is a RIM entry point (Act, Role, or Entity)

element.short: Key images associated with this report
element.definition: A list of key images associated with this report. The images are generally created during the diagnostic process, and may be directly of the patient, or of treated specimens (i.e. slides of interest).
element.requirements: Many diagnostic services include images in the report as part of their service.

element.definition: A comment about the image. Typically, this is used to provide an explanation for why the image is included, or to draw the viewer's attention to important features.
element.comment: The comment should be displayed with the image. It would be common for the report to include additional discussion of the image contents in other sections such as the conclusion.
element.requirements: The provider of the report should make a comment about each image included in the report.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Reference to the image source.

element.definition: Hier wird der Befundtext angegeben.
element.comment: Note that FHIR strings SHALL NOT exceed 1MB in size
element.requirements: Need to be able to provide a conclusion that is not lost among the basic result data.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Codes for the clinical conclusion of test results
element.definition: One or more codes that represent the summary conclusion (interpretation/impression) of the diagnostic report.
element.comment: Not all terminology uses fit this general pattern. In some cases, models should not use CodeableConcept and use Coding directly and provide their own structure for managing text, codings, translations and the relationship between elements and pre- and post-coordination.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Diagnosis codes provided as adjuncts to the report.

element.definition: Hier wird der Befund/Bericht als Anhang in Form eines formatierten Dokuments abgebildet.
element.comment: "application/pdf" is recommended as the most reliable and interoperable in this context.
element.requirements: Gives laboratory the ability to provide its own fully formatted report for clinical fidelity.

element.short: Mime type of the content, with charset etc.
element.definition: Identifies the type of the data in the attachment and allows a method to be chosen to interpret or render the data. Includes mime type parameters such as charset where appropriate.
element.comment: Note that FHIR strings SHALL NOT exceed 1MB in size
element.requirements: Processors of the data need to be able to know how to interpret the data.

element.comment: Note that FHIR strings SHALL NOT exceed 1MB in size
element.requirements: Users need to be able to choose between the languages in a set of attachments.

element.comment: The base64-encoded data SHALL be expressed in the same character set as the base resource XML or JSON.
element.requirements: The data needs to able to be transmitted inline.

element.short: Uri where the data can be found
element.definition: A location where the data can be accessed.
element.comment: If both data and url are provided, the url SHALL point to the same content as the data contains. Urls may be relative references or may reference transient locations such as a wrapping envelope using cid: though this has ramifications for using signatures. Relative URLs are interpreted relative to the service url, like a resource reference, rather than relative to the resource itself. If a URL is provided, it SHALL resolve to actual data.
element.requirements: The data needs to be transmitted by reference.

element.short: Number of bytes of content (if url provided)
element.definition: The number of bytes of data that make up this attachment (before base64 encoding, if that is done).
element.comment: The number of bytes is redundant if the data is provided as a base64binary, but is useful if the data is provided as a url reference.
element.requirements: Representing the size allows applications to determine whether they should fetch the content automatically in advance, or refuse to fetch it at all.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The calculated hash of the data using SHA-1. Represented using base64.
element.comment: The hash is calculated on the data prior to base64 encoding, if the data is based64 encoded. The hash is not intended to support digital signatures. Where protection against malicious threats a digital signature should be considered, see [Provenance.signature](provenance-definitions.html#Provenance.signature) for mechanism to protect a resource with a digital signature.
element.requirements: Included so that applications can verify that the contents of a location have not changed due to technical failures (e.g., storage rot, transport glitch, incorrect version).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Label to display in place of the data
element.definition: A label or set of text to display in place of the data.
element.comment: Note that FHIR strings SHALL NOT exceed 1MB in size
element.requirements: Applications need a label to display to a human user in place of the actual data if the data cannot be rendered or perceived by the viewer.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The date that the attachment was first created.
element.requirements: This is often tracked as an integrity issue for use of the attachment.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Dieses Profil bildet einen Befund / Bericht ab.
Hier wird der Status des Befunds/Berichts als Code aus dem ValueSet: http://www.hl7.org/fhir/valueset-diagnostic-report-status.html angegeben.
Hier wird der Inhalt bzw. die Bedeutung des Elements anhand eines entsprechenden Codes oder alternativ mit einem Freitext angegeben.
Hier wird ein Freitext eingetragen.
Hier wird der Titel des Dokuments angegeben.
Hier wird das Datum angegeben, das für den Befund/Bericht relevant ist.
Hier wird der Zeitraum angegeben, der für den Befund/Bericht relevant ist.
Hier wird die Person referenziert, die für Erstellung des Befunds/Berichts verantwortlich ist.
Hier werden die einzelnen Ergebnisse des Befunds/Berichts referenziert
Hier wird der Befundtext angegeben.
Hier wird der Befund/Bericht als Anhang in Form eines formatierten Dokuments abgebildet.
